attributes.action: Remove the smoking ban in mental health units/psychiatric units
attributes.background:
Remove the smoking ban in mental health units in hospitals across the country and allow mental health patients a very basic freedom of choice. 
A designated smoking area for psychiatric patients isn't much to ask for, especially when the old smoking areas are still there.
attributes.additional_details:
I have been sectioned under the mental health act since the smoking ban came into effect. It now enforces severely unwell people to quit smoking suddenly, with no choice but to comply. Whilst under section you are not permitted to leave the ward and there is not a designated smoking area in any ward.
This wasn't always the case, in fact there are still designated smoking areas In all mental health units that are now disused. It's cruel to force a person to quit smoking at such a difficult point in their lives.

attributes.action: Force employers to show salary and benefits on all advertised jobs
attributes.background:
All too often jobseekers find a job they would like to apply for, they apply, attend interview, receive a job offer and then are frustrated with a disappointing salary and benefits package.
Legislation should be introduced that will see all employers having to advertise the full benefits package.

attributes.action: Abolish the time limitation act 1980 regarding money owed
attributes.background:
I feel that this law should be changed  to enable people to get their money back 
Court costs are too prohibitive following the six year time bar limit
attributes.additional_details: I am sure I am not alone when it comes to being in this situation

attributes.action: Increase funding for ambulances so they reach people in time, every time.
attributes.background: The fact is that the ambulance service is under increasing strain. Ambulance staff are working incredibly hard with inadequate funding. This is not acceptable. Sign this petition to force the government to debate this issue that affects everyone.

attributes.action: Stop the process of the European Union (Withdrawal) (No. 3) Bill 2017-19.
attributes.background: A Bill currently on the second reading stage in Parliament has been set out to force the government to seek an extenstion on Article 50, if a deal is not agreed in Parliament. I believe that this will not help things with brexit causing a lot more devision accross the country.
attributes.additional_details: I would like to see this Bill scrapped in the House of Commons as this hinders the vote of the British people.

attributes.action: Hold a new Brexit referendum at the next General Election if UK has not left EU
attributes.background: In the event that the UK has not yet left the EU by the time that the next General  Election is called, a new referendum on U.K. membership of the European Union (Brexit) should be held. Voting should take place at the same time as choosing a Member of Parliament, but with a separate ballot.
attributes.additional_details:
Brexit negotiations are causing instability in Parliament. The chances of a leadership challenge, or a vote of no confidence, are high. This could trigger a General Election.

If the British public are to be subjected to yet another General Election before we have formally left the EU, the opportunity should be taken to run a new, better “Brexit” referendum.

This will stop campaigning, and the outcome of an election, being misrepresented as a Brexit mandate, when it is in fact a vote for an MP.

attributes.action: Start school at 9am and finish at 5pm to introduce children to the working world
attributes.background: Some believe that children and teenagers should be afforded the luxury of starting school at 10am. School hours should reflect the working world instead.

attributes.action:
Ban alcohol advertising.
Label all alcohol with correct health & safety warning
attributes.background: I started drinking alcohol from a young age without any advice or warning of the dangers of this addictive drug. It has caused me much misery and I have witnessed much misery. There needs to be more education to help save lives to help save our children.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol kills around 3 million people a year. It destroys lives, it destroys relationships. It is an addictive drug and shouldn’t be advertised. It shouldn’t be attractively packaged and should be labelled with all the health and safety warnings. We need to help save future generations.

attributes.action: Now facts are known, allow the public to vote between no deal or remaining in EU
attributes.background: The government can not agree on a brexit agreement with the EU, and now full facts on what a No deal brexit means, the public should be allowed to make an informed vote on remaining in the EU or having a no deal Brexit

attributes.action: Review and amend the Mental Health Act 1983.
attributes.background: As someone who has had a range of mental health conditions, I'm taking it upon myself to get legislation updated in line with today’s requirements and to ensure other victims are supported.
attributes.additional_details:
Firstly, the Mental Health Act 1983 is a piece of legislation from nearly 36 years ago. Awareness, understanding and support has changed vastly in those years, so it's about time legislation did too. 
 
Secondly, some of the content of the act is simply degrading for victims and sufferers of this condition and other conditions similar to it. There are mentions in the Act to detain individuals experiencing or who have experienced an episode for 6 months. As matter of fact, this makes victims worse.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum annual leave entitlement from 5.6 weeks to 7.6 weeks.
attributes.background:
The increasing retirement age leaves far less to look forward to at the end of our working lives. We are asking for increased minimum annual leave entitlements during our working lives to compensate for this loss.

This will give us more time with our families and to follow our own interests.
attributes.additional_details:
Retirement age is increasing (currently 67). Estimates are that when today's teenagers retire, the retirement age will be 75. People currently look forward to retirement but with increasing age there are fewer possibilities for those years.

Give us extra leave during our working years so that we can feel that we have lives and interests beyond work. It will reduce stress and exhaustion as well as increase happiness.

We will benefit, our children will benefit, our employers will benefit.

attributes.action: Allow towns to sack county police force and form a town or city force if failed
attributes.background: County police forces do not spread resources correctly and need more police on our streets. Allow constituencies to hold a town vote on whether their police force is better handled by the county or locally in your town or city. Funding from council tax budget which is paid to county force will fund.
attributes.additional_details: Sussex police have failed to tackle many crimes in our area and hardly see a police presence on a day to day basis, youth crime, vehicle crime and public disorder is at a all time high in Arun. Chief Constable York has failed our town. The people deserve this responsibility to have their lives and well being protected.

attributes.action: Add Height and Weight as Protected Characteristics to The Equality Act
attributes.background: Height and weight discrimination are not even implemented under The Equality Act 2010, which is meant to be a law for everyone so that it "legally protects people from discrimination in the workplace and in wider society”, Gov.uk.
attributes.additional_details: Important protected characteristics such as age, race and sexual orientation, (all things that cannot be controlled), are included yet height and weight, (some medical conditions mean weight cannot be controlled, such as an underactive thyroid and Cushing's syndrome, NHS.uk), are ignored by our government. Is it fair that only some members of society are legally protected from being discriminated against?

attributes.action: Outlaw all Premium and Higher rate telephone charges for mobiles and landlines.
attributes.background: Not all numbers are classified as Premium rates yet incur extortionate charges. Some Premium calls are regulated but some are not. The most vulnerable in society incur these charges. The proposal therefore is that all these telephone numbers, whether presently regulated or not are outlawed.

attributes.action: Renumber the A1(M) from Leeds to Newcastle as the M1
attributes.background: As the A1 has now been upgraded to motorway standard from Leeds to Newcastle for the entire length,to the A1(M), it would make more sense to renumber this section as t he M1, to create a continuous M1 motorway from London to Newcastle.
attributes.additional_details: Renumbering the A1(M) to the M1 would be enormously beneficial to the counties of Yorkshire, County Durham and Tyne and Wear.

attributes.action: Maintenance payments (inc Spousal) as an attachment of Earnings or via Court
attributes.background: When maintenance is not paid after a Court has ordered it it is wrong to have to keep going back to Court to enforce. Apart from the trauma that you go through for years in my case, and the cost which ran into thousands, why should you have to wait and fight again after an order is made
attributes.additional_details:
It is also a fact that the time it takes to enforce can put that person into even more debt, or the chance to lose their home when maintenance isn’t paid.
It is obvious the person isn’t going to want to pay, which is why it ends up in Court, so why is this not taken as an attachment of earnings or via Court within the order?
The system doesn’t allow for both parties to get on with their lives as it states is the purpose when the one side is always unsure of receiving what was fought for

attributes.action: Start safeguarding parents from abusive ex-partners.
attributes.background: I want to safeguard mothers and fathers who have been victims of abuse from and ex partner. We must change the law and guidance to prevent parents from being expected to enter mediation with their abuser.
attributes.additional_details: Many women and men are expected to mediate with abusive ex-partners for the ‘benefit’ of the child whilst no safeguarding is considered for the parent who has to mediate with someone who mentally, physically or sexually assaulted them. Many parents’ well-being is forgotten in these circumstances, and lives can be put at risk if we keep ignoring this.

attributes.action: Fine for parked car running over 1 minute and let people provide evidence of it.
attributes.background:
My child have born recently I understood there is necessary to do something about unnecessary usage of fuel.
In average city I can't walk a few meters to not smell terrible diesel exhaust. 
So
-no idling the car over 1 minute
-when asked to switch off and ignored video footage could bring a fee.
attributes.additional_details:
There is a new legislation about it but its completely useless to bring somebody to responsibility for this behaviour.
I really don't believe people stop speeding when they could avoid the fine being asked to slow down and obey the request.
Lots of cars make the same pollution(some of the gases) while idling when driving even they use much less fuel. I'm driver and i don't want to stop usage of fuels and cars but save the environment and the wallet when possible to make our place to live better

attributes.action: HGVs restricted to first two lanes of motorways & be restricted at peak times.
attributes.background: HGVs, vehicles above 7.5 tonnes, cause restricted traffic flow when overtaking on motorways during busy periods.  HGVs should be restricted to the 1st lane during peak hours, using overhead signage, and should not be able to enter the third lane on four lane motorways.
attributes.additional_details: These restrictions are already in place all over the European motorway network and help traffic flow.

attributes.action: Make the sale age of Tobacco 21
attributes.background:
Increasing the sale age to 21 would decrease the use of tobacco nationwide. 

But ultimately the main goal is to be the first country to ban the sale altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside increasing the sale age to 21 this would decrease the use of tobacco use,  making steps towards the ultimate goal of banning the sale of tobacco altogether, the UK would make the first country to band the sale of a Dangerous cancer killing drug 

The idea that everyone knows how much it kills is the strangest part about it and as a country we need to me the first move.

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Let's get Thornton back on track - Reinstatement of the rail link.
attributes.background: The rail link from Poulton Le Fylde to Fleetwood via Thornton closed to to passengers in 1970 and to freight in 1999. The effect on our transport infrastructure and on jobs has been devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
Why do we want this?
1. To better connect Thornton Cleveleys to Poulton and Fleetwood (via rail and / or tram)
2. To battle the traffic congestion on our roads
3. To bring greater employment opportunities and economic prosperity to the area

attributes.action: Force rail companies to freeze rail fares for at least 5 years.
attributes.background: The new rise in rail fares is criminal and only lining the pockets of the wealthy running the trains in Britain. We demand that the rail fares be frozen so that people are not being stripped of their cash and being made poorer just to get to work.

attributes.action: Require unused hospital and pharmacy prescriptions to be reused, not thrown out
attributes.background: My client was a pharmacist in a UK hospital. All prescriptions that were not collected from patients are put in the bin if not collected and not reused. this is a complete waste of money. They are not opened and not used we need to stop this.

attributes.action: Reform GDPR/Data Law with Automatic Fines on Bodies/Organisations not Complying
attributes.background: Since the GDPR was updated in May 2018 some public bodies/organisations still do not comply. Reform GDPR/Data Law to impose Automatic Daily Fines for failure to respond/comply with a data request within 1 month. If any records are withhold an automatic fine of the ICO maximum of £500,000 must apply
attributes.additional_details: If public bodies/organisations wish to recover some of the costs of the fines they will have to appeal to court to prove which information is being withheld/concealed from individuals & why, how the information was gathered & generated or records contaminated. If proven there is an attempt to obstruct justice those involved should be ordered to pay towards the fine/costs. We must have accountability across our public services, every individual in the UK is entitled to access to all their records

attributes.action: SELECTIVE licensing for tenants should be removed or applied for all landlords.
attributes.background:
SELECTIVE licensing for certain areas and certain landlords is unfair.

The law should be same for all where ever you live in the country.

This should also be applied to letting agencies and housing estates.
attributes.additional_details:
Lisence is applied when you commence a business and require authority of the council this should be same for everyone not selective.

Also the law should be applied to council areas not privately owned.

Safety of tenants can also be address in many other ways.

We are all equal in England and the law should be passed for all not few.

attributes.action: Require differential off-peak electricity rates.
attributes.background: The energy companies have eroded the differential between the night time and day time electricity tariffs, originally introduced to provide competition to other providers of energy, such as oil and gas.
attributes.additional_details: The recent hikes in off-peak rates for electricity have made heating homes for users of storage heaters, in particular, very difficult. Many people, often pensioners, invested in this form of central heating years ago and would find a change to oil (or gas if available) central heating prohibitive.

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrants’ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: More Money For Unemployed
attributes.background: Unemployed People Like Myself Struggle To Put Food On The Table. Afford Gas And Electric And Rent Top Ups. We Should Get Additional Support From DWP

attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Consider funding a northern bypass for Ipswich.
attributes.background: The Orwell bridge. A14. Major artery from the expanding port of felixstowe. When the bridge gets closed in either direction due to bad weather, usually high winds, or a road traffic incident. All traffic is diverted through Ipswich town which causes absolute mayhem.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-suffolk-44656588

One particular day the wind brought down trees and blocked local roads which were already congested due to tge bridge closure. This particular day it took me 90 minutes to get to work, 7 miles away...! There was an idea of allowing cars only in high winds but surely that would pose health and safefy issues.

attributes.action: Change 30 hours free child care eligible 51 weeks a year instead of term time
attributes.background: Current funding of 30 free hours only covers term time which for most working parents only actually covers maybe a day and a half child care as like me most work full time meaning if you have more then 1 child costs soon add up.  get the government to change 30hours free a week not just in term

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement to inform UK phone callers the cost of phone calls
attributes.background: The cost of phone calls from a mobile phone or landline should be regulated so that prior to connection a prerecorded message should make the charge per minute clear to the caller and all Utility companies and Charities for the low paid and vulnerable should have available freephone contact numbers
attributes.additional_details: Offcom really need to put their house in order they have consistently failed to inform the public about how much money they are paying for phone calls especially on 'pay as you go'. Some phone numbers in the UK which are regularly used by those on low incomes and those on benefits are being charged at exorbitant rates which they can ill afford. Im sue many of these people end up not making  calls because of the cost and end up being penalised for not informing a company or government department

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all vehicles to be fitted with a dash cam
attributes.background: Too many people are killed or seriously injured on UK roads.  Around 95% of incidents are caused by human error; what a driver does or fails to do.  Cameras would make drivers more responsible for their actions and save a lot of time investigating incidents.  Dashcam evidence could be conclusive

attributes.action: Reduce the 0.7% GDP target for Foreign Aid to 0.5% and increase NHS spending
attributes.background: Consultation with the average citizen would know doubt raise numerous stories of concern. A greater financial injection would be very beneficial and help address many issues e.g. GP Waiting times, A and E pressures, lack of funds for research, especially for childhood diseases and cancer treatment.
attributes.additional_details: Ask the people of the UK: Should more money be spent on the NHS and less on overseas aid? The answer would no doubt be 'Yes'.

attributes.action: Require the Traffic Light System on all children’s food!
attributes.background: As an Early Years Practitioner, I have noticed how little the “Traffic Light System” is put on the children’s foods. I feel like this is a necessary so that the children can understand whether it is healthy or not. Colours are so simple to a child so this is a much better method than just numbers.
attributes.additional_details: The country encourages Healthy Eating however, they don’t teach children in the way that they would understand the best. Numbers mean nothing to the children, however, they realise that colours have meaning. For example; Red means Bad and Green means Good.

attributes.action: Ensure All UK Local Councils Provide Recycling Bins in All Public Spaces
attributes.background:
The recent advertising campaign, encouraging recycling at home is right, 'One Bin IS Rubbish!'

But what if you're on your way to work, eating lunch on the go, or on a night out? How do you recycle then?
Most local councils do not provide public recycling bins, sign here if you think they should.
attributes.additional_details:
The London Mayor is aiming to make London a Zero Waste City by 2026, but what about the rest of the UK?

Recycling schemes are organised and funded by local councils. However, this issue is not a local one, but a global one.

The government should make it mandatory to provide recycling bins in all public areas nationwide, and provide local councils funding to implement these bins and dispose of recycling correctly.

People may not throw away less rubbish, but we can throw it away, the right way.

attributes.action: Cancel South Western Rail’s contract
attributes.background: Since SWR took over, trains are routinely late, strike action has spiked and, despite a 3% fare increase, passengers have seen no respite. For the sake of the economy and the wellbeing of commuters, SWR should be stripped of their contract. They are not fit to run a rail franchise.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.cityam.com/269303/waterloo-chaos-south-western-railways-tells-commuters-not

https://www.getsurrey.co.uk/news/surrey-news/how-south-western-railway-performed-14988660

attributes.action: Legislate a Less Lethal Firearms license for civilians
attributes.background:
A Less Lethal Firearms license should be legislated for civilians to purchase, possess, open carry and use PAVA Spray and/or a Taser.

This should be accompanied by a Firearms Act 2020 amendment with Section 5 exemptions for civilians with a license.
attributes.additional_details:
In the wake of increasing violent crime and strain on the Police Service, civilians with jobs such as Security Guards, Doormen, Delivery Guards and Neighbourhood Patrol groups should have a lawful right to a low risk form of OCW (Open Carry Weapon) for use in defence, escape and citizens arrests with lower casualty risks when confronted with physical violence.

Security checks and training in correct and lawful use should be mandatory before purchase and ownership of a Taser or PAVA Spray.

attributes.action: Give every house free solar panels so we can burn less fossil fuels
attributes.background: If every house gets a solar panel for free they will stop buying electricity and use the free electricity coming from the panel. This can help the environment and reduce climate change

attributes.action: Introduce 'on road' Cycling to Driving lessons/Driving Test
attributes.background: Driving Test/Lessons to include 3 Hours (30 minute segments) of on road cycling for those able to do so
attributes.additional_details: Give humans the perspective to see the road from both a driving a car and riding a bicycle
